intro: Caralluma pillansii, commonly known as the desert nightshade, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the Solanaceae family, which includes other nightshades like tomatoes and peppers. The plant is characterized by its fleshy, spiny stems and small, bell-shaped flowers that bloom at night. It is adapted to survive in harsh, dry environments through its succulent leaves and deep root system. Caralluma pillansii is also noted for its ability to store water, making it a resilient species in desert conditions.
